description_html: Keep it objective: no first or second person.
story_html:
Make it personal (first and second person ok), preferably with a beginning, middle, and end.

To keep up to date, follow this site on social media or join the SeeOurMinds.com email list!

image_list.title: Norm Petersen
image_list.subtitle_html: Barfly at Cheers
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Norm Petersen's spiritual portrait shows he is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Norm's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Norm's auxiliary personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/subjective decisions.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.title: Cliff Clavin
image_list.subtitle_html: Postal Worker and Barfly at Cheers
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Cliff Clavin's spiritual portrait shows he is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Cliff's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.
The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Cliff's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective decisions.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (NOTE THAT IS EASIER TO FIND EXAMPLES OF DECISIONS THAN PERCEPTIONS!) ....

image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Lilith's dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.
The Blue in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than of facts.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Lilith's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
